title: Javascript Software Engineer
description:
Javascript Software Engineer

At SovTech we design, build, deploy and maintain innovative custom software that gives our clients the opportunity to start, run and grow world class businesses We are currently on the lookout for Software Engineers to join our team on a variety of projects that are kicking off over the next few months. Our teams are rapidly growing and we are looking for Developers that are passionate about building software for our World class clients. Firstly...We LOVE Javascript.

Job requirements We are looking for Javascript Developers at ALL levels in all regions. Our head quarters are in Johannesburg, South Africa. 

We have Guilds situated in Cape Town, Johannesburg & London.

If you have experience working with ReactJS, React Native, Nodejs, Typescript & AWS specifically, you might be what we have been searching for!  Our Technology Stack, We build almost everything on the Serverless framework with AWS behind the scenes. We love React on the front, web and mobile. 

SovTech Tech Stack:  Backend:

  • GraphQL
  • REST
  • NodeJS

Frontend:

  • ReactJS
  • React Native
  • Typescript
  • CSS-in-JS (Styled Components)
  • Tests first

Cloud Services: Numerous AWS services:

  • AppSync
  • Cloudfront
  • CloudWatch
  • Cognito
  • Lambda
  • DynamoDB
  • S3
  • SES
  • SNS
  • SQS

And many more!

Other notable tech things

  • Bitbucket + JIRA + Slack
  • Git-Flow
  • Monorepo approach
  • AWS CDK
  • Serverless framework
  • Docker + Docker-Compose
  • Create React App
  • Industry best practices + standards

What cool things do we offer at SovTech?

  • Annual full-company X-mas retreat
  • Dev chats every Friday with a beer or dial in from where ever you are based in the world
  • Do you enjoy Soccer? Join our SovTech Stars Soccerclub
  • Do you enjoy running? Join our SovTech running Club
  • Slack channels like #Memes, #Geekingitup, #10o’clockrock, #AmazingDesigns #HumansofSovTech that connects you to our network of awesome people
  • Hatch (Annual company-wide hackathon)
  • Annual FoosFestival with our very own Minister of Foosball
  • Our own currency(Stacos) - 50 Stacos is given to each employee every month by the company to spend on rewarding and recognising your colleagues, Stacos are redeemable for a variety of online shopping vouchers

Remote vs On-site We believe in teams. Our teams are often distributed but everybody has a home base. We call it a Guild. At present, you must be in Johannesburg, London, or Cape Town. How else do we have a beer on a Friday together? But yes you can also work from home when you want. Is this you? Join us! Apply via the application button.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Microsoft Software Engineer. Dublin, Ireland.
description:
About This Role:

Microsoft engineers inspire, empower and lead. As an engineer at Microsoft Ireland, you can develop solutions used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. With teams working on Microsoft 365, Azure, Modern Workplace Transformation Solutions, Identity and Natural Language Experiences, there is no limit to what you can achieve

We are recruiting Software Engineers for teams across the organisation. Successful candidates must have an inquisitive, can-do mindset.The ability to break barriers, challenge the status quo, and build connections across organizations is crucial.

If you want to build best-in-class solutions using robust coding practices and the latest tech in a fast-paced DevOps environment, apply today.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and deliver the next generation of highly scalable, intelligent cloud services and products.
  • Build and support modern web applications and large-scale distributed services.
  • Produce high quality code that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked regularly for continuous integration.
  • Collaborate with colleagues including product owners, UX designers, ML Engineers/Researchers, data scientists and other engineers to create delightful and meaningful experiences for our customers.
  • Evangelize and/or propose new ideas while "bringing others along”.
  • Demonstrate a sense of pride, ownership, and personal accountability for end-to-end products.
  • Learn continuously and work comfortably with the latest technologies (serverless, containerized apps, AI/ML, IoT, .NET Core, etc.) in Microsoft. 

Job Requirements:

Basic Requirements:

  • At least 5 years of experience as a software engineer or as a software developer
  • 3 years' minimum software development experience using OOP languages (C#, C++, Java, etc.)
  • 2 years' minimum experience working with cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, or similar
  • Experience with distributed systems design and implementation, especially microservices architecture
  • Software engineering fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, async programming patterns, object-oriented design, parallel programming).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with TypeScript or JavaScript or React or Angular;
  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical experience is required.
  • Machine Learning or Deep Learning experience would be a bonus but not required. After all, we believe in learning and growing on the job.

About you

Are you customer obsessed? Do you think about your customer’s needs and the scenarios they will arise in? Do you demonstrate user empathy and seek to create solutions that delight your customers?

Are you passionate about learning and applying the latest technologies while building high-quality web applications, APIs and microservices with high availability and reliability?

If this all sounds like you, you’re exactly the kind of candidate we’re looking for. Apply today.

About Microsoft Engineering

At Microsoft Engineer you can have impact at scale. we embrace the Growth Mindset to deliver impactful solutions for our customers. Collaboration, innovation and customer obsession are central to our culture. This environment inspires better solutions for our customers, partners and ultimately the world.

Benefits

  • Industry leading healthcare
  • Savings and investments
  • Generous annual leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Opportunities to network and connect
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Giving programs
  • Educational resources

Benefits/perks listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Equal Opportunities

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
how_to_apply: For more information and to apply, visit https://www.microsoft.com/en-ie/futurenavigators

company: MANDARIN MEDIEN Gesellschaft für digitale Lösungen mbH
title: Frontend Developer
description:
2002 sind wir als Internetagentur gestartet. Heute bezeichnen wir uns als Digitalagentur. Das Spielfeld ist heute breiter und greift tiefer in bestehende Geschäftsbereiche ein. In unseren 3 Units MARKETING, DIGITAL & TALENT arbeiten über 80 Macher, Nerds und Kreative nach einem Prinzip: Messbar mehr Erfolg. Das heißt konkret: Klare Ziele. Permanente Optimierung. Transparentes Reporting.

Wer wir sind

2002 sind wir als Agentur gestartet. Heute arbeiten über 80 Macher, Nerds und Kreative bei uns. Wir sind Strategen, Experten, Zuhörer, Kollegen, Freunde, Aufdenpunktbringer, Sprachgewandte, Texter und Erfolgshungrige. Gemeinsam entwickeln wir sehr wirkungsvolle Lösungen in den Bereichen Digitales Marketing, Employer Branding und Digitalisierung für Marken, wie Cinestar, Vodafone, Garmin, Wemag und viele mehr. Wir entwickeln Online-Marketing-Strategien, bauen innovative Websites und haben auch sonst die gesamte Vielfalt des Agenturlebens zu bieten.

Das wären Deine Aufgaben

Du willst eine Mandarine werden?

Du liebst gut bedienbare, gut aussehende und gut funktionierende Websites? Du liebst es noch mehr, diese selbst zu entwickeln? Du möchtest mit einem erfahrenen Team aus Anwendungsentwicklern, Konzeptern, Designern, Marketingexperten uvm. arbeiten? Eine Crew hinter dir haben, dir dir das Frontend überlässt? Dann bist du die perfekte Mandarine im Bereich FRONTEND DEVELOPMENT!

Das bringst Du mit

DAS SOLLTEST DU MITBRINGEN:

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in HTML,CSS, Javascript
  • Umgang mit entsprechenden Techniken und Frameworks (React, LESS/SASS, Tailwind, Bootstrap o.ä.)
  • Eigenständiges Arbeiten, Teamgeist, Kommunikationsfähigkeit
  • Ein sehr hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein

Von Vorteil sind:

  • Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse z.B. in PHP -Verständnis von OOP
  • GIT Kenntnisse
  • Verständnis von Datenbanken, z.B. MySQL
  • Verständnis von API
  • Alltagssicheres Englisch

Nahezu großartig wären:

  • Drupal 7&8 Kenntnisse
  • WordPress Erfahrung
  • Verständnis von Template Engines wie Twig oder Blade

Klingt ganz schön viel? Nobody is perfect! Wir lernen jeden Tag voneinander und nehmen uns jede Woche Zeit für Weiterbildung. Die ein oder andere Fähigkeit kannst Du also auch nach Deinem Start bei uns erlernen oder vertiefen.

Das bieten wir Dir

DAS KÖNNEN WIR DIR BIETEN:

  • Einen spannenden und anspruchsvollen Agentur-Job in MV
  • Eine große Bandbreite an Projekten - Handwerk bis Konzern
  • Ein hervorragendes Arbeitsklima und kurze Entscheidungswege
  • 4 Stunden Zeit für deine Weiterbildung je Woche plus Budget
  • Neueste Arbeitsmittel und Programme
  • Unterstützung deiner Gesundheit
  • Fahrtkostenzuschuss
  • Flexible Arbeitsorte
  • Kreative Denkpausen mit dem Boot auf dem Schweriner See
  • Teamevents, wie z.B. Grillen, MANDARIN-Kino, Besuch des Weihnachtsmarktes und noch ein paar mehr
  • Ein Büro mit Blick auf den Schweriner See sowie lecker Obst, Kaffee, Tee, Wasser und Mate

Kontakt

Passt alles für Dich? Dann schick deine Bewerbung mit deinen Vorstellungen zu Gehalt und Urlaub an Corinna Lepsien, jobs@mandarin-medien.de. Oder falls du gerade unterwegs bist einfach einen Link zu deinem Xing- oder LinkedIn Profil.

title: Senior iOS Developer
description:
YAZIO was founded in 2013 and, with millions of users, YAZIO is one of the most successful nutrition apps in the world. YAZIO has a mission: To help as many people as possible live healthier lives through better nutrition. With users in more than 150 countries, we’re well on our way to accomplishing this goal. As a remote-first company, we promote a modern form of employment in which our team works together across several cities and countries.

Find out more about our team, our application process and open positions here: www.yazio.com/en/jobs

Hey there!

Are you a change-maker who loves technology and working independently towards ambitious goals? Do you want to work remotely on a great product and in a lovely team?

In this case, we are looking forward to your complete application documents. As an international team English is our company language, we therefore only accept applications in English.

Your Mission

  • Be a part of our development team for our native iOS App
  • Write "clean code" and deal with architectural patterns
  • Write tests and ensure proper functioning of our CI server
  • Work with the latest technologies (e.g. SwiftUI, Combine, etc.)
  • Work closely with our product, design and development teams
  • Take the YAZIO iOS app to the next level for millions of users

Your Profile

  • At least once in your life you stood in front of an Apple store waiting for a new iPhone to be sold
  • You love Apple products
  • At least 3-5 years experience in iOS development
  • In-depth understanding of “imperative” and “declarative” programming
  • You master our basic technology stack (Swift, UIKit, SwiftUI)
  • You master basic architectural patterns (MVC, MVVM)
  • You are up-to-date concerning the latest Apple features (widgets, app clips, subscription offer codes)
  • Eye for a great, user-friendly iOS UI
  • Experience in developing apps based on "webservices" (REST, JSON)
  • Experience with Combine, Kotlin, XCTest and watchOS is a plus
  • Degree in computer science or similar is a plus, but not a must
  • Interest in nutrition and fitness is a plus

Why us?

  • An exciting project with millions of users in over 150 countries, localized in 20 languages
  • A great team with start-up spirit, high flexibility and flat hierarchies
  • As a “remote first” company with a pronounced remote culture, you'll have the option to work 100% remotely (must be located in CET time zone +/- 2 hours)
  • If desired, we can provide you with a co-working space of your choice
  • Access to state-of-the-art technical equipment of your choice (laptop, smartphone, external monitor, etc.)
  • Attractive salary and vacation days
  • Our work culture is characterized by focus and efficiency. We do not work overtime and, in the rare occasions that it is necessary, you can take the additional hours off at another time
  • A dynamic work environment with plenty of room for personal development, direct communication and flexible working hours
  • Exciting team retreats and events several times per year and much more

Sound like you?

Ready to bring YAZIO to the next level together and help people all over the world live healthier lives? Then we’re looking forward to receiving your application! Please provide the following:

  • Your CV
  • A cover letter explaining who you are and why you want to work at YAZIO
  • Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)
  • If you have, a link to your Github / Reddit / Stackoverflow profile
  • Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about your interests (e.g. your Twitter/Instagram account or your blog/website)

title: App Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Exciting projects - flexible working hours - responsibility - teamwork

Do you want to gain insights into a unique startup? At epap, our mission is to revolutionise the handling of receipts. Aiming to sustainably shape the retail industry, we are redefining the receipting process in a way that benefits both consumers and retailers. Located in the heart of Hanover, our team of young and motivated minds are now seeking an experienced and passionate software developer to lead various projects. This opportunity is a full-time position with the option to work from home.

Your Impact

  • As one of the first employees, you will actively contribute to the success of the company
  • Take on a key role in our development and influence our future technological direction
  • Implement new features in the app with a special focus on great UX
  • Make designs intuitive to experience
  • Modularise the existing code to improve performance

Your Profile

  • You are willing to relocate to join the core team in Hanover
  • You are communicative, open-minded and like to work in a team
  • You have a strong 'hands-on' mentality, you love to approach new challenges and to see the impact of your work
  • You see challenges as opportunities and enjoy taking on responsibility
  • You are passionate about challenging the status-quo and doing things differently
  • You have expert knowledge in the field of App Development
  • You have experience with Flutter and Dart, and have a feeling for when it is useful to outsource functionalities to the cloud
  • You have experience with App Development via Firebase and/or Google Cloud Functions or have a strong motivation to get into it
  • You have good communication skills in English
  • You have a degree in computer science, artificial intelligence, data science, or a similar field of study or relevant practical experience

Keywords: App Developer, Cross-Platform Developer, Flutter Developer, App Developer Flutter, App Developer iOS & Android

Your Benefits

  • Be part of a young, motivated team with flat hierarchies and cheerful colleagues who are looking forward to working with you
  • As part of our mentoring program, you will be assigned a mentor to assist with any forthcoming questions
  • New challenges every day to help you to develop personally and professionally
  • Exciting projects and the opportunity to get involved in every facet of the company
  • Flexible working hours on a trust basis and the possibility to work remotely or in our office in the VentureVilla
  • An additional day off on your birthday
  • One Learning Day per month, giving you the opportunity to learn, improve and grow both personally and professionally
  • Great team events
  • Delicious coffee, lemonade, water and also beer to celebrate our successes together

We are looking for team members of all stages of life who are talented and have the drive to share our values and advance our vision. Are you looking for an opportunity to see success through your passion and a team with whom you can work together to reach your full potential? Then apply to join us!

Courage, simplicity, and trust are our core values. What are yours?
how_to_apply: Email your resume to team@epap.app and tell us why you are motivated to join epap.

title: DevOps Engineer with PHP
description:
Kinsta is a modern cloud hosting company focused on WordPress hosting. We run our services on cutting-edge technology and we are proud of the level of support we offer to our customers. Our talented and motivated team is scattered across the globe with team members hailing from every continent but Antarctica! We're constantly on the lookout for great talent to join our awesome team. If you’d like to become part of the Kinsta family, just hit apply!

We are looking for a motivated and professional DevOps Engineer to help us maintain the best-performing hosting architecture on the market.

You will be instrumental in making sure our architecture is always on the bleeding edge of technology remaining stable and high performing at all times. This involves:

  • Optimizing server provisioning
  • Fine-tuning our servers on a system level and on application level
  • Ensuring high scalability as the number of created VMs increases on our network
  • Overseeing and ensuring smooth running and completion of server-wide updates
  • Ensuring optimal software communication between our server architecture and our hosting platform (MyKinsta)
  • Acting as an escalation point for our SysOps team if a bug or issue proves to be particularly difficult
  • Creating tools to prevent or mitigate instances of high load, ensure security and stability throughout the system

Requirements

  • At least 5 years of experience working with Ubuntu/Debian
  • 3 years of experience with PHP
  • Experience with a PHP framework
  • Deep knowledge of LXC
  • Strong experience writing Ansible scripts
  • Experience with Nginx
  • Previous experience in the hosting industry
  • Excellent general understanding of Linux, cloud networking and server management
  • Technical awareness and ability to quickly understand new technologies

Bonus skills

  • Experience with the standard WordPress stack (PHP, MySQL, WordPress)
  • Experience working with ZFS
  • Experience working with ELK stack
  • Experience with Node.js apps
  • Database query optimization
  • Having worked in JIRA
  • Good understanding of APIs and web service
  • Deep knowledge of Google Cloud based server architecture

Benefits

  • Fully remote culture with a globally distributed, international team
  • We offer a flexible and relaxed working environment where everyone can work in peace
  • In order to ensure that everyone has time to rest and recharge, we offer Flexible paid time off
  • We do not have any investors and we do not work directly with clients. This means we rarely have any deadlines and have the luxury of thinking features through and implementing them correctly instead of quickly
  • Everyone has a voice in the development process
  • We work with only the newest and best technology

title: Cloud Transformation Delivery Manager (d/m/w)
description:
Seit mehr als 130 Jahren legen Versicherte in Deutschland ihre Risiken des Alltags vertrauensvoll in die Hände der DEVK Versicherungen. Heute ist die DEVK bundesweit präsent und betreut die persönlichen Anliegen von über vier Millionen Kunden in allen Versicherungssparten. Wir entwickeln in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachbereichen innovative und digitale Lösungen mit dem Ziel unsere Kunden und Kollegen im Innen- und Außendienst zu begeistern. Die Cloud ist dabei für uns als strategische Plattform gesetzt. Daher gestalten wir unsere Cloud Transformation ganzheitlich von der Strategie über unser Operating Model und die Architektur bis hin zur Organisationsentwicklung. Als Cloud Transformation Delivery Manger arbeiten Sie als festes Teammitglied in unserem Cloud Competence Team, welches die Cloud Transformation verantwortet und an unser Top Management berichtet.

Ihre Aufgaben

  • Unterstützung bei der Aktualisierung und Kommunikation der Cloud Strategie
  • Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung des IT Operating Models mit den Schwerpunkten Aufbau von Service Broker Fähigkeiten und Einführung von DevOps
  • Aufbereitung und Herbeiführung strategischer und taktischer Diskussionen und Entscheidung mit unserem Top Management
  • Fortführung unserer Cloud Adoption Roadmap sowie Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung eines Cloud Transformation Dashboards
  • Beratung der Fachbereiche bei der Identifizierung von Cloud Potentialen sowie Unterstützung bei der Initialisierung und Durchführung von Cloud Initiativen
  • Ausbau unseres Cloud Transformation Partner Netzwerks und Steuerung der externen Partner
  • Beobachtung und Kommunikation von Entwicklungen am Cloud Markt bzw. bei Cloud Technologien

Ihr Profil

  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Erfahrung in führenden Rollen bei der Durchführung und Steuerung von (Cloud-) Transformationsinitiativen im Konzernumfeld
  • Mehrjährige Tätigkeit als interner bzw. externer Berater / Consultant
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse bei der Entwicklung von Roadmaps und dem Aufbau von Dashboards auf Basis von Metriken
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse von klassischen und cloud-basierten IT Operating Modellen
  • Erfahrung in der Einbindung und Steuerung von externen Partnern
  • Aktuelle Kenntnisse sowohl des Cloud Marktes als auch von Cloud-Technologien & Services
  • Stark ausgeprägte Moderations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
  • Gut ausgeprägte Leadership-Kompetenzen in den Bereichen strategisches Denken sowie fachliche, hierarchieunabhängige Führung
  • Hoher Teamgeist und großes Augenmerk auf partnerschaftliches Miteinander
  • Mut und Ausdauer innovative Ideen zu vertreten und zu treiben

Unsere Benefits

  • Sichere Arbeitsplätze in einem stetig wachsenden Unternehmen
  • Eine hervorragende arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersversorgung
  • Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle
  • Homeofficeoptionen
  • Stark vergünstigtes Job-Ticket Informieren Sie sich über unsere weiteren Benefits (Link: https://bit.ly/3qoCugs)

Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie persönlich kennenzulernen. Falls Sie noch Fragen haben, rufen Sie uns gerne an.

Ihre Ansprechpartnerin Tanja Willing Tel.: +49 221 757-1154

title: Technical Writer
description:
You will be joining Developer Relations team of Teleport, unified access plane for SSH, Kubernetes and Database infrastructure. Teleport is a Y-Combinator company that is well funded by additional top-tier investors and growing quickly.

Nasdaq, SumoLogic and Samsung Electronics trust Teleport to secure access to their infrastructure.

Teleport is an open source, written in Golang with web-based UIs in JavaScript with React.

Here is why we love this job ourselves, and hope you will enjoy it too:

  • Our documentation is open source
  • We are so passionate about docs we have built open source documentation engine
  • Develop local version of the documentation and deploy in minutes automatically
  • We use privacy respecting analytics

Here are the projects you may be working on:

  • Writing documentation from getting started articles to in-depth architecture guides
  • Writing sample code in Golang, Python and Rust
  • Sending PRs to core Teleport code base to improve error messages and user experience
  • Creating video guides, walk-throughs and webinars

What to expect once you apply:

  • We will send you a 20-30 minute programming quiz
  • You will join 30 minute intro call and we will walk you through the compensation, interview process and requirements
  • You join a slack channel and submit a coding and documentation challenge in Golang or Rust using Github

Requirements:

  • Golang or Rust experience
  • Interest and experience in writing documentation, explaining how things work and engaging with community
  • Cryptography engineering experience is a plus

We offer competitive compensation and benefits, platinum level healthcare insurance, 401k matching, and a great place to work.

Teleport is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classifications protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Lead Java Engineer
description:
Join an innovative, inclusive company as senior Java Engineer in the development and evolution of our enterprise platforms delivering industry-leading health intelligence solutions.

As the Lead Java Engineer you will deliver unified solutions for our healthcare customers. You will be managing teams and the software development life cycle along with building and designing systems that deliver data visualization, analytics, personalized health journeys and shopping experience to our customers.

Your responsibilities:

● Lead software projects from requirements and development through testing and release using the agile scrum methodologies

● Identifying, analyzing and developing Java-based web and mobile applications.

● Leading and integrating with a team of developers

● Designing local database architecture and integrating with operational data systems

● Ensuring that development projects meet security, uptime and stability requirements

● Integrating solutions with third-party data-feeds and software

● Writing efficient code, reviewing, testing and debugging team’s code

● Contributing to development of technical documentation and user manuals

● Keeping current on technology trends and working to incorporate improvements as applicable

Your qualifications:

● You have a high level of expertise developing, releasing, and maintaining high throughput Java microservices using Spring Boot and working with REST APIs

● You have a BS degree in computer science, math or related field is preferred

● You have experience deploying and interfacing with scalable container technologies (Docker)

● You know Agile and can help evolve our process.

● Experience in healthcare industry with knowledge of HIPPA &/or NIST Security standards a plus

● You have at least 3 years experience in the following

     Java application development and UI frameworks

      ○ Java, Javascript (Python, PHP, R and bash scripting is a plus)   

      ○ Database solutions including MySQL and Snowflake

      ○ Agile/Scrum development with JIRA and Crucible

      ○ Developing and maintaining RESTful web services

      ○ Working with CI/CD build servers such as Jenkins, Bamboo or Team City

      ○ Working with GIT version control system

      ○ Team Leadership

      ○ Expertise in Linux, particularly CentOS/RHEL 7+

      ○ Microservices, SPA, Spring Boot, Servlet API, JMS, OAuth 2.0, Springfox, React, Aurelia

Your benefit package:

● Medical, Dental and Vision

● 401(k) with match

● Paid Holidays

● Generous PTO

Finity is an equal opportunity employer and actively recruits people of color, women, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ people.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Vehicle Command & Control
description:
About Saildrone

Saildrone designs and manufactures wind and solar powered autonomous surface vehicles called Saildrones, which make cost-effective ocean data collection possible at scale. We are working with governments, civic agencies, foundations, universities and private companies around the globe to drive better information about our oceans and seas - be it in mapping out the ocean floor, collecting new CO2 data in hard-to-reach areas, counting bio-mass to establish fishing quotas, or detecting and stopping illegal fishing and drug trafficking. We believe that better inputs in planetary models in turn yield better outputs and that the new insights gained in weather forecasting, carbon cycling, global fishing and climate change will have tremendous impact on humanity. We are based in Alameda, CA and are backed by Social Capital, The Capricorn Investment Group, Lux Capital, Horizons Venture and The Schmidt Family Foundation

The Role

As a member of the Vehicle Command & Controls team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing software that runs on board our Saildrones - to communicate over satellite comms, navigate the ocean as instructed by remote pilots, detect and avoid obstacles on the horizon, and control low level actuators that actually make this all possible. You’ll also work closely with sensor payloads on board the vehicle - radar and camera systems, oceanographic and bathymetry sensor suites, etc.

Required Skills

  • Strong C++ skills - the ability to design and implement reliable, maintainable, and testable object-oriented code.
  • Comfortable enough with python to maintain and expand scripts and tooling in that language.
  • A background in robotics, autonomous vehicles, or vehicle controls.
  • Strong interpersonal skills - someone who pairs well with others, and is eager to help guide the technical direction of our software stack, and diligently review other’s code and designs.

Desired Skills

  • Experience implementing gRPC.
  • Familiarity with the Bazel build system.
  • Experience with low-level CAN protocols, CANopen, J1939, NMEA2K.
  • Knowledge of sailing mechanics
  • A background in general control systems - navigation and guidance, robotic controls all excellent examples.

Location:

This position is located in Alameda, CA. Only candidates with proper permits to work in the United States can be considered. Our waterfront office offers beautiful views of San Francisco Bay in always sunny Alameda. Even our walls have good karma, our offices mix software development with a hardware production line in the former airplane hangar used to film 'The Matrix'.

Benefits:

  • Medical, dental and vision plans for you and your dependents
  • Active sailing classes: become a certified skipper on boats up to 35ft! (once COVID safety allows)
  • Short and relaxing ferry ride from the Ferry Building for SF residents
  • Enhanced paternity / maternity programs
  • Competitive benefits including excellent medical, life insurance, 401k plan

This is an exciting opportunity with a fast-growing post series-B startup at the cutting-edge intersection of big data services and autonomous hardware. You will be an integral part of a high-performing multi-disciplinary delivering high impact for humanity and future generations.

You can read the latest about us:

Saildrone Surveyor Launch (Jan 2021)

Washington Post: Four autonomous vessels sailed the Arctic to more precisely map its seafloor(Oct 2020)

USNI: Coast Guard Begins At-Sea Testing of Unmanned Surface Vehicles to Tackle Illegal Fishing, Crime (Oct 2020)

Forbes: Five Ways Saildrone’s ‘Satellites Of The Seas’ Could Transform Mauritius Oil Spill Response (Sept 2020)

Maritime Executive: Due to COVID-19, NOAA Uses Drones Instead of Ships for Fishery Survey (June 2020)

Or watch some of our videos: Bloomberg: The Robots Roaming the High Seas

Saildrone is an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Saildrone are considered property of Saildrone and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
About Us: Saildrone designs and manufactures wind and solar powered autonomous surface vehicles called Saildrones, which make cost-effective ocean data collection possible at scale. We are working with governments, civic agencies, foundations, universities and private companies around the globe to drive better information about our oceans and seas - be it in mapping out the ocean floor, collecting new CO2 data in hard-to-reach areas, counting bio-mass to establish fishing quotas, or detecting and stopping illegal fishing and drug trafficking. We believe that better inputs in planetary models in turn yield better outputs and that the new insights gained in weather forecasting, carbon cycling, global fishing and climate change will have tremendous impact on humanity. We are based in Alameda, CA and are backed by Social Capital, The Capricorn Investment Group, Lux Capital, Horizons Venture and The Schmidt Family Foundation.

The Role: This position will work closely with a teams of engineers, product managers, and engineering leadership to plan and execute a software roadmap for vehicle code running on Saildrones. This will involve software that commands and navigates drones remotely in real time, sensors and scientific payloads that gather data for clients, and camera-driven ML systems which identify ships and obstacles on the horizon. You’ll work closely with all parties involved - managing engineers directly, conducting 1v1s and performance reviews, marshalling and tracking work for engineering teams through to completion each sprint. You’ll also be coordinating with other managers to lay a course for future work and resourcing on a quarterly basis.

Requirements:

  • You will be working closely with a highly technical software stack, so mastery of software engineering is essential.
  • Not merely tracking work, You will help the team make good software design decisions. We are looking for a candidate who has transitioned their career from software engineering to software management.
  • Experience with compiled languages (C, C++, Golang, Objective-C, or Swift) and ARM architectures is ideal, but candidates with an exceptional track record in python will be considered.
  • Demonstrated track record managing teams of engineers (5 or more) is strongly preferred.
  • Collaborative work style, placing achieving common goals first
  • This role requires extensive hands on time with our team based in Alameda, CA HQ
  • Proven advocacy for teams and experience leading others to excel is essential.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with modern Agile software management practices
  • High comfort level prioritizing the work of software engineering teams
  • JIRA experience

Location:

This position is located in Alameda, CA. Only candidates with proper permits to work in the United States can be considered. Our waterfront office offers beautiful views of San Francisco Bay in always sunny Alameda. Even our walls have good karma, our offices mix software development with a hardware production line in the former airplane hangar used to film 'The Matrix'.

Benefits:

  • Medical, dental and vision plans for you and your dependents
  • Active sailing classes: become a certified skipper on boats up to 35ft! (once COVID safety allows)
  • Short and relaxing ferry ride from the Ferry Building for SF residents
  • Enhanced paternity / maternity programs
  • Competitive benefits including excellent medical, discounted gym, life insurance, 401k plan

This is an exciting opportunity with a fast-growing post series-B startup at the cutting-edge intersection of big data services and autonomous hardware. You will be an integral part of a high-performing multi-disciplinary delivering high impact for humanity and future generations.

You can read the latest about us:

  • Saildrone Surveyor Launch (Jan 2021)
  • Washington Post: Four autonomous vessels sailed the Arctic to more precisely map its seafloor(Oct 2020)
  • USNI: Coast Guard Begins At-Sea Testing of Unmanned Surface Vehicles to Tackle Illegal Fishing, Crime (Oct 2020)
  • Forbes: Five Ways Saildrone’s ‘Satellites Of The Seas’ Could Transform Mauritius Oil Spill Response (Sept 2020)
  • Maritime Executive: Due to COVID-19, NOAA Uses Drones Instead of Ships for Fishery Survey (June 2020)
  • Or watch some of our videos: Bloomberg: The Robots Roaming the High Seas

Saildrone is an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Saildrone are considered property of Saildrone and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

title: Software developer
description:
The Institute for Corporate Productivity (i4cp) has an opening for a talented and motivated developer to join our software product team. We are looking for an engineer who takes pride in robust and maintainable code and likes to build well-designed software.

You will work in a flexible environment with a remote-friendly team where you will be encouraged to bring fresh ideas and new perspectives to the position.

About the role

As a developer you will work directly with the software development team and the Vice President of Marketing & Technology to bring new products to market and enhance existing functionality to meet our user needs. You will:

  • Contribute to the design and implementation of software products.
  • Collaborate with the team to gather and define feature requirements.
  • Help support the deployed production environment.
  • Maintain and improve existing technologies.

About you

  • 2-4 years experience building, testing, and shipping production-ready software.
  • Comfortable with the Ruby on Rails or similar web frameworks.
  • Familiar with the Javascript programming language.
  • Knowledge with HTML, CSS, and related technologies.
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Have curiosity, like to explore technology, and are always growing and learning.

Also helpful

  • Comfortable with basic Linux server administration tasks.
  • Familiar with Javascript frameworks such as Vue or React.
  • Familiar with Docker or similar container technologies.
  • Experience integrating with partner APIs.
  • Experience with mobile platform development.
  • Front-end UI/UX experience.

Benefits

  • Paid vacation/sick leave
  • 401(k)
  • Medical/dental/vision
  • Stock options
  • Flexible work environment

Location

  • We are based in Seattle, but this is a remote role.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Remote)
description:
Forza Football is looking for Elixir developers to join our talented team (remote or in Gothenburg, Sweden).

You will be working on the services that power our mobile apps—from the API that serves millions of clients to the push notification system that keeps our users up-to-date on their favourite football teams and competitions. You will have the benefit of working together with an Elixir Core team member in a small group of skilled developers and designers dedicated to building top-tier mobile products for football fans all over the world.

The Forza Football app covers over 800 leagues and competitions in more than 100 countries. The app has over 10 million installs and over 4 million monthly active users. At peak hours our platform handles thousands of requests per second and sends millions of push notifications.

This opportunity requires you to have:

  • Experience with Elixir and OTP: you have developed applications for production use
  • An interest in systems that are highly available, resilient, and run at scale
  • Sense of craftsmanship: you strive for code quality and maintainability, write tests as part of your coding routine
  • Knowledge about caching strategies, message queues and service-oriented architectures
  • An understanding of setting up infrastructure and managing Linux servers
  • Experience with deployment tooling, monitoring, alerting, data visualisation, load testing and/or live system debugging
  • Strong communication skills. Be a team player, pay attention to detail, and be not afraid to share unconventional ideas
  • Good oral and written skills in English, as Forza Football operates globally, and many employees are international

We do not hire solely based on experience with a few specific tools or languages or university degrees. Rather, we hire developers who are smart, pragmatic, and self-driven. We value want you to be able to learn new tools and function in an agile environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and are excited to expand our team with diverse talents from different backgrounds and cultures.

In addition, as an employee of Forza Football, you also get:

  • Flexible work hours
  • Six weeks paid vacation
  • Parental leave benefits
  • Computer and gadget setup needed for work
  • Breakfast in the mornings
  • Regular Afterwork events
  • Conference visits with accommodation and travel expenses paid
  • Relocation support and visa sponsorship

title: Fullstack Developer (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind die 247GRAD Labs GmbH, das IT-Unternehmen hinter dirico, der All-in-one-Plattform für Kommunikations- und Marketingteams.

dirico unterstützt Unternehmen weltweit dabei, ihren Content besser zu planen, zu erstellen und zu veröffentlichen als jemals zuvor. Das macht unsere Kunden so glücklich, dass sie dirico bereits in über 20 Ländern einsetzen. Unser Kundenkreis wächst stetig und beinhaltet einige der Top-50-Unternehmen Deutschlands.

Deshalb suchen wir Dich als Unterstützung für unser Team in Koblenz und Oradea (Rumänien).

Erfahre mehr über uns und wirf einen Blick hinter die Kulissen.

Das sind deine Aufgaben

  • Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Softwarelösung mit den Schwerpunkten C#, .NET, React und Angular
  • Erstellung von Systemarchitektur und Softwaredesign
  • Aktive Mitgestaltung der Infrastruktur und eingesetzten Prozesse im Entwicklungsteam
  • Einsatz und Test modernster Praktiken und Umsetzung neuer Ideen
  • Evaluierung und Auswahl neuer Technologien für die Nutzung in der Entwicklung
  • Zusammenarbeit in einem international agierenden Umfeld von Entwicklungsteams

Das solltest Du mitbringen

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in .NET und C#
  • Kenntnisse in mindestens einem der JavaScript-Frameworks wie React, Angular oder Vue.js
  • Erfahrungen mit TypeScript, HTML und CSS sind gerne gesehen
  • Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich von relationalen Datenbanken/SQL, Design Pattern sowie gängigen Frameworks (z.B. EF)
  • Optimalerweise bringst du Erfahrungen zu Schnittstellen von Social-Media-Plattformen mit
  • Sicherer Umgang mit objektorientiertem Code, UML und Design Patterns
  • Scrum, Git und Clean Code sind keine Fremdwörter, sondern alte Bekannte
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse der deutschen und der englischen Sprache
  • Eine analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, Zuverlässigkeit und Lösungskompetenz zeichnen dich aus, messbare Ergebnisse sind Dir wichtig
  • Du bist bereit, dich weiterzuentwickeln und neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen
  • Erfahrungen mit der Azure Plattform runden Dein Profil ab
  • Selbstständige Arbeitsweise
  • Du bist engagiert und hast Interesse daran, Dich mit Deiner Meinung aktiv im Team einzubringen

Das erwartet dich bei uns

  • Ein innovatives Softwareprodukt im spannenden Marketing-Kontext
  • Renommierte Referenzkunden wie BMW, ThyssenKrupp, Lanxess, WetterOnline, R+V, Dr. Oetker, Sport2000 und viele mehr
  • Ein stark wachsendes und motiviertes Team mit Weltklasse-Kollegen
  • Abwechslungsreiche und anspruchsvolle Aufgaben, die Spaß machen
  • Echte Start-up-Atmosphäre in einem mittelständischen Unternehmen
  • Flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege für Deine kreativen Ideen
  • Agile Arbeitsprozesse und modernste Hardware
  • Ein jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget zur Unterstützung Deiner fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
  • Flexible Vertrauensarbeitszeit in Gleitzeit
  • Die Möglichkeit auf Homeoffice nach Absprache
  • Ergonomisches Arbeitsumfeld mit höhenverstellbaren Tischen und rückenschonenden Stühlen
  • Zuschuss zum Premium-Fitnessstudio Danys
  • Regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
  • Frisches Obst, Kaffeevariationen und Wasser for free
  • Kein Dresscode – wir wollen, dass Du dich wohlfühlst, also: come as you are
  • Unsere Bürohunde sind ausgebildete Feelgood-Manager

title: Softwareentwickler Backend (PHP/Symfony) (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind die Boxine GmbH aus Düsseldorf. Wir stellen Hörfiguren her, die wir Tonies nennen. Zusammen mit unserem mehrfach prämierten Abspielgerät - der Toniebox - verschmelzen Hören und Spielen zu einem interaktiven Erlebnis, das Kinder, Eltern und Großeltern zusammenbringt.

Du als Teil der Tonie-Familie:

Möchtest du helfen, Familien auf der ganzen Welt mit unseren Tonie-Produkten zu versorgen? Hast du Spaß und Erfahrung im Bereich E-Commerce? Wenn du diese Fragen mit einem klaren "JA!" beantworten kannst, dann sollten wir unbedingt miteinander reden. Denn dich suchen wir! Als Shop Developer (m/w/d) am Standort Düsseldorf oder remote (deutschlandweit) arbeitest du in einem hoch qualifizierten Team zusammen an unserem Shop und unserer Webseite. Neben der Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Systeme ist auch die Weiterentwicklung für die Expansion in viele weitere Märkte deine Aufgabe. Usability, Sicherheit, Stabilität und Qualität stehen dabei immer an oberster Stelle deiner ToDo Liste.

Deine Aufgaben umfassen:

  • Du kümmerst dich um Konzeption, Entwicklung und Deployment von Shop und Webseite
  • Du baust das System auf und verbesserst es kontinuierlich
  • Du wirkst bei der Gestaltung von Systemarchitekturen und der Auswahl von Technologien (insbesondere Internationalisierung für weitere Märkte) mit
  • Du sorgst für Qualitätssicherung und Dokumentation
  • Du arbeitest eng mit Stakeholdern wie Marketing, Customer Support und Supply Chain zusammen

Was wir uns von dir wünschen:

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung im IT-Bereich
  • Du hast sehr gute Erfahrungen mit PHP7
  • Du hast eine selbstständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
  • Du bist erfahren in der agilen Softwareentwicklung (inkl. Git, Pull Requests, Code Reviews)
  • Du bist teamfähig, kreativ und bringst viel Neugier mit
  • Du hast gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
  • Du hast idealerweise weitere spezifische Kenntnisse in: MySQL, PHPUnit, Commercetools, Gitlab CI, AWS
  • Du hast Erfahrung im Design und der Implementierung von REST-APIs mit Symfony
  • Idealerweise hast du Erfahrung mit JavaScript (insbesondere React und Next.js), um mit dem Frontend zusammenzuarbeiten
  • Und das Wichtigste: Du bist genauso begeistert von der Toniebox wie wir und möchtest bei unserer aufregenden Reise dabei sein!

Wie du uns erreichst:

Falls möglich, sende uns bitte ein kleines Motivationsschreiben, deinen CV sowie Codebeispiele (am besten mit Git-History) oder URLs von programmierrelevanten Online-Profilen (Github, Stackoverflow usw.) zu, damit wir ein erstes umfangreiches Bild bekommen können.

Wir freuen uns sehr, von Dir zu hören. Solltest du vorab Fragen haben, melde dich gerne bei:

Martin Suhrbier Recruiter

Boxine GmbH Grafenberger Allee 120 40237 Düsseldorf +49 151 54 68 32 57

title: Sr Software Developer
description:
Sr Software Developer

Employment Type: Full-time employee.

Level: Senior.

Location: Remote - Frogslayer will consider candidates located anywhere in the US with proper work authorization.

Comp: $75k to $150k base salary. Compensation for this role will be based on candidate's experience, potential for contribution, and scope of role.

Who We Are

Frogslayer is a custom software development and digital innovation firm. Clients partner with Frogslayer to rapidly build, launch, and scale forward-leaping, industry-shattering software products and digital platforms that create new revenue streams and sources of competitive advantage.

To deliver the very best for our clients, we start with our people. In this position, you will be challenged to deliver innovative solutions that make a lasting and significant impact on companies and industries. Our people and teams are empowered to make the decisions they need to serve our clients. Since every role at Frogslayer is significant to the success of our clients, you'll be given great responsibility and have the authority you need to deliver results.

Frogslayer, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We offer a generous benefits package, including company contribution to medical benefits for employees and their families. In addition, we offer a fun, flexible work environment, company-sponsored activities, and commit to providing each employee with job satisfaction by addressing core needs.

If you are someone who wants to be a contributing member of an exciting team that has been continually recognized by Inc. and Texas Monthly as a best place to work, then read on my friend and learn about this position.

Who You Are

In this critical role, your clients will rely on you to solve their most complex technology challenges and deliver measurable business results. If you're looking for real responsibilities, autonomy over your work, flexibility over your schedule, and the opportunity to deliver software that people use and rely on every day then this is the job for you. This is a tremendous opportunity for professional growth. There will be constant change, but one thing is certain - you will learn more and grow faster at Frogslayer than you will anywhere else.

Job Requirements

At Frogslayer, you'll be working on a variety of projects that include web, desktop, mobile and embedded systems. It's not uncommon for someone to move from developing a new web application in Python over to a system written in C# or PHP. We're technology agnostic and are more concerned about creating high-impact business outcomes for our clients. For each project, we select the best tools for the job. Common technologies, tools and libraries we use include: Python, Django, C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Jenkins CI, GitLab, Docker, Ansible, MVC, SPA, AWS, Azure, Web API, HTTP, REST, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL.

Responsibilities

  • Develop custom software - yes, this position is 80-90% coding.
  • Assist in the design of project architecture.
  • Write code for the application scaffolding and complex features.
  • Break down work into assignable items and estimate effort and schedule.
  • Assign project tasks and issues for yourself and junior team members.
  • Review team members' work and give constructive feedback on improvements.
  • Develop junior team member’s ability to work through problems, interact with clients, and design practical solutions.
  • Meet clients in person or remotely to give regular updates and ensure the team is staying tied to their needs.
  • Create design documents and key artifacts for the project.
  • Meet with operations leaders to discuss project goals, solution quality, schedule and progress, and the overall client relationship.

Apply via the application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer 36 - 40 uur | Rotterdam

We zijn op zoek naar een Software Engineer die onze dienstverlening helpt opschalen en tegelijk steeds completer maakt. Denk hierbij aan asynchrone backend processing, queue strategieen, praten met diverse databases en alles ontsluiten via API’s. Maar vooral héél veel e-mails 😄

Ontmoet Flowmailer Bij Flowmailer timmeren we hard aan de weg als internationale SaaS-leverancier met onze e-mail engine. Dat doen we met een klein, maar toegewijd team dat e-mail (deliverability) ademt. Je komt terecht in een team dat barst van de kennis, enthousiasme én trots over ons vakgebied.

Flowmailer beschikt over een eigen infrastructuur en IP netwerk in drie datacenters waarmee we honderden miljoenen e-mails per jaar verwerken. Wij zorgen er voor dat tickets, facturen en andere belangrijke e-mails altijd netjes worden afgeleverd.

Daar zijn we enorm trots op! Dit alles hebben we in eigen beheer en ontwikkeling. Het platform en de software stack die daarop draait vormt de kern van onze dienstverlening. De betrouwbaarheid en schaalbaarheid hiervan is dus ontzettend belangrijk voor ons en onze klanten. Wij zijn op zoek naar een collega die ons hierbij kan helpen en het leuk vindt om hieraan mee te bouwen.

Nieuwsgierig naar je nieuwe collega's? Ontmoet ons virtueel via LinkedIn

Wat ga jij doen? Samen met je collega’s zorg jij ervoor dat Flowmailer nóg beter wordt. Je ontwikkelt voornamelijk in Java, maar natuurlijk komen HTML, JavaScript en allerlei frameworks ook voorbij. Wat je ontwikkelt wordt ook echt gebruikt en onze klanten hebben hoge verwachtingen van onze betrouwbaarheid, performance en veiligheid.

Je werkt nauw samen met product management, operations en support en hebt af en toe contact met (technische) klanten. Samen streef je naar een optimale ervaring voor klanten en ontvangers van onze e-mails.

Wie ben jij? Je bent een sterk analytische Software Engineer die graag van A tot Z een goed product neerzet. Je geeft om het resultaat (ook op de lange termijn) en bent betrokken. Je hebt ervaring met ontwikkeling in Java, Spring, API koppelingen en kan overweg met complexe database queries en het optimaal afstemmen van de software op het onderliggende platform. Je kunt uit de voeten met inrichting op Linux servers en duikt graag de diepte in om dingen écht te doorgronden.

Verder breng je het volgende mee:

  • Tenminste 3 jaar relevante ervaring;
  • HBO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Afgeronde studie richting ICT;

Onze nieuwe collega is verder accuraat, integer en heeft een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel. We zijn immers verantwoordelijk voor de verwerking van grote hoeveelheden persoonsgegevens. Daarnaast kun je goed samenwerken en heb je een goed gevoel voor humor. Uiteraard zijn computers, internet en software een passie voor je.

Wat wij te bieden hebben We bieden je een werkomgeving waarin je wordt uitgedaagd om elke dag het beste in jezelf naar boven te halen. Ons vakgebied is immers altijd in ontwikkeling. Groei met ons mee in een bedrijf met internationale ambities.

Dit mag je ook van ons verwachten:

  • Een veelzijdige en zelfstandige functie, met veel eigen verantwoordelijkheid;
  • Een team vol gezelligheid, creativiteit en enthousiasme, die er elke dag vol voor gaan;
  • Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden (o.a reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling);
  • Gezellig bedrijfsuitjes (die soms erg actief kunnen zijn);
  • Een bureau op de mooiste plek van Rotterdam: in de monumentale Van Nelle fabriek.
how_to_apply:
Solliciteer dan vandaag nog en wordt onze nieuwe Software Engineer!

Neem contact op met Richard van Looijen (Directeur) via richard@flowmailer.com of 010-3074556.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Software Tester
description:
Software Tester

32-40 uur, Amersfoort

Ben jij een software tester met oog voor detail en gebruiksvriendelijkheid? Combineer jij jouw testervaring met passie voor innovatieve test tooling? Dan ben jij mogelijk onze nieuwe software tester! Het betreft een vaste functie op onze vestiging in Amersfoort.

Jouw rol

Als software tester bij ANVA beoordeel en test je onze software op functionaliteit, gebruiksvriendelijkheid en correctheid. Je gaat aan de slag in onze multidisciplinaire SCRUM-teams en maakt de testscripts voor het zowel handmatig als geautomatiseerd testen van de software. Hiervoor werk je nauw samen met testers uit andere teams. Kwaliteit stroomt door jouw bloed, en je weet ook dat de wereld snel aan het veranderen is op gebied van technologie. Om die reden ben je altijd nieuwsgierig en combineer je dit met passie voor innovatieve test tooling. ANVA werkt zoals gezegd met multidisciplinaire teams, dit betekent dat je als proactief tester, impact kunt maken en ben je er vooral om het verschil te maken. Naast veel passie voor je vak sta je communicatief stevig in je schoenen en vind je het een uitdaging om met deadlines om te gaan.

Als software tester ga je aan de slag binnen één van de verschillende SCRUM-teams. Jij bent samen met jouw team verantwoordelijk voor kwaliteit. Je onderhoudt de bestaande test-set en gaat aan de slag om de testdekking te vergroten en controleert op juistheid en volledigheid. De testpiramide is geen vreemde voor je en weet jij de testen op de juiste niveaus te ontwikkelen. Je bent proactief en gaat zelf actief op onderzoek uit als dit nodig is. De teamleden testen elkaars werk en tijdens de 'refinements' adviseer je over de mogelijke risico’s die geïntroduceerd worden. Je coacht daarmee de ontwikkelaars op het testvlak en je kan ook uitleggen waarom je dit adviseert. Bovendien controleer je met plezier het solution design en UX/UI design. Daarnaast ben je in staat om een goede inschatting van de werkzaamheden af te geven, zodat we voorspelbaar blijven.

Ben jij onze Software tester?

Wat heb je in huis?

  • Hbo-werk- en denkniveau.
  • Een aantal jaren relevante en recente werkervaring.
  • TMAP of ISTQB gecertificeerd of bereid dat te worden.
  • Kennis van Docker, Git, Java, Junit, Postman, Cypress en/of Json.
  • Inzicht in CI/CD, kennis van build pipeline tool zoals Jenkins.
  • Kennis van het principe van microservices, NoSQL database en Angular is een sterke pre.
  • Ervaring in de assurantiebranche en/of met onze ANVA-software is een sterke pre.
  • Ervaring met het werken in scrum (of agile) teams is een pre. 

ANVA, jouw ideale werkgever

Je kunt rekenen op de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Afhankelijk van opleiding, ervaring en achtergrond bedraagt het maximale bruto jaarsalaris € 60.000,- uitgaande van een 40-urige werkweek.
  • Aandacht en ruimte voor eigen ontwikkeling en opleidingen.
  • Initiatief, ondernemerschap en lef wordt gewaardeerd en gestimuleerd.
  • Een open en informele bedrijfscultuur met korte communicatielijnen.
  • Collegialiteit en samenwerking staan voorop in onze teams.  

Over ANVA

Vol trots maakt ANVA al ruim 45 jaar softwareoplossingen voor de verzekeringsbranche. Meer dan tienduizend financieel professionals gebruiken onze software om miljoenen consumenten en duizenden ondernemers een goede verzekering te kunnen aanbieden. Om meer wendbaarheid en een grotere klantgerichtheid te creëren, werken we bij ANVA o.a. volgens de agile en LEAN-methode. Onze vestigingen in Amersfoort en Bergen op Zoom kenmerken zich door de relaxte sfeer. Bij de koffie-corner babbel je regelmatig even met collega’s, we hebben fijne werkplekken en een bedrijfsrestaurant met een uitgebreid assortiment. Bij ANVA zijn wij kritisch naar elkaar, leggen we de lat hoger dan onze concurrenten en vragen we onze klanten of we de juiste dingen aan het doen zijn. Dit alles doen we samen, in een sterk teamverband. We helpen elkaar om het steeds weer beter te doen. Onze werkwaarden Altijd Helder, Samen, Leren Loont en Persoon Gedreven zijn hierin onze leidraad.   

Ja, ik heb interesse!

Voor meer informatie over deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Patrick Keijer (HR) via 033-4798200 of hr@anva.nl. Meer informatie over werken bij Anva vind je op https://anva.nl/werken-bij-anva/.

Solliciteren kan via het sollicitatieformulier.

Een assessment maakt onderdeel uit van het selectieproces en in de afrondende fase vragen we je een vog aan te vragen. Waar wacht je nog op?    

_NB: wij zijn voor deze functie NIET op zoek naar een interim invulling of deta-vast constructie! _

title: Market Data Analyst
description:
Data makes the difference! An opportunity to deliver the highest standards of data analysis and interpretation for our dynamic international logistics operation.

Samskip is a forward-thinking logistics company, operating within a dynamic international arena that generates significant amounts of real-time data. Could you organise, analyse and interpret that data, converting it into information that will generate meaningful insights that enable better business decisions? If so, read on and find out more about this role at the cutting edge of advanced statistical modelling.

A company where innovation meets ambition

Samskip is committed to innovating and applying sustainable and multimodal transport links across Europe. Within this network, our office in Cluj-Napoca plays an important role in our data analytics activities. It’s busy, it’s fun and every day is different as you work with a diverse range of colleagues to deliver 21st-century transport solutions based on highly sophisticated data analysis.

A fascinating data challenge

This is a challenging role in which you work with Samskip’s data team to create and manage analytics solutions that turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. In doing so you interpret data and analyse large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns. You also perform the financial, statistical, and qualitative data analysis of markets and competitors, enhancing our business intelligence capability. Detailed activities include:

• Identifying valuable and appropriate data sources in relation to competitors, industry suppliers, markets, macro-and microeconomics;

  • Developing and maintaining databases, automated data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality;
  • Undertaking the pre-processing of structured and unstructured data;
  • Monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements;
  • Presenting information using data visualisation techniques.

Based on the thorough gathering and expert interpretation of data you propose solutions and strategies to business challenges. This requires you to work with management to prioritise business and information needs, always seeking to locate and define new improvement opportunities.

A great place to develop your career

At Samskip we want you to be the best you can be. That’s why you’ll be able to access wide-ranging development opportunities including training and e-learning through our Samskip Academy. You will also benefit from an open working environment where you are challenged every day while working as a team. And we do all we can to ensure that Samskip is a company where colleagues become friends. Other benefits include:

  • A competitive compensation package;
  • 21-25 days of annual leave;
  • Meal ticket;
  • Transportation allowance;
  • 7Card Sports subscription;
  • Medical insurance;
  • A laptop and a mobile phone.

Are you the entrepreneurial analyst we are looking for?

To apply for this position you need to be a highly accurate, analytical and critical thinker with a talent for interpreting complex and multiple sources of information. But you should also be someone with an entrepreneurial mindset who can develop and expand the role in order to go the extra mile and propose solutions that make a real business difference.

There will be some pressure and tight deadlines so you need to be a flexible and effective decision-maker who can disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. At the same time, you should be able to eliminate non-value adding activities. With all this will come the excellent communication and collaboration skills necessary to engage and influence others in order to get the job done.

You tick all the following boxes:

• BSc/BA or MSc in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.

  • Proven working experience as a (business) Data Analyst, preferably within the logistics/transport sector; • Strong knowledge of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;
  • Experience with reporting packages (Power BI etc.), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, SSIS or ETL frameworks);
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc).

Apply today

If you think you could be a great asset to Samskip based on everything you’ve read here, don’t hang around. Click on the 'Apply' button and send us your CV. If you have any questions about the vacancy feel free to call us on 088 – 400 13 93 or send an e-mail to: career.management@samskip.com.

title: Software Security Engineer
description:
Yubico’s mission is to create a safer internet for everyone. Our core invention, the YubiKey, a hardware-based token, revolutionized secure logins for top Internet brands, including Google and Facebook, and for millions of users in 160 countries. We are seeking an experienced Software Security Engineer to join our Product Security team.

The Role

Reporting directly into our CISO, our Product Security team is responsible for ensuring Yubico develops and maintains secure products and services. As a Software Security Engineer, it is important that you bring not only strong technical expertise in product security, but also the ability to successfully collaborate with a diverse set of engineering teams.

As a company, Yubico has grown from 50 to almost 300 employees over the past four years, and the security team is growing and maturing along with it. Our small but impactful team of four find their day to day responsibilities at Yubico are fluid and varied, spanning a wide variety of technologies and unique challenges. The diverse opportunities that come their way provide a variety of exciting growth opportunities.

Our ideal candidate will have the opportunity to shape the future of Yubico’s products, services, and the operations of an industry leading security company. If you are looking for a fun challenge, are passionate about security, and would like to join a team where being a security person isn’t such a bad thing (it’s really good, actually), we welcome you to apply.

Responsibilities

  • Define and evangelise requirements and guidance for secure by design and secure by default principles
  • Implement automation to prevent and detect security flaws in all phases of development
  • Conduct design reviews and manual security assessments of our software
  • Lead training and awareness sessions
  • Define and implement metrics to provide visibility into the impact of your work
  • Define, lead, and influence processes to secure products and services
  • Identify and advocate for new and novel uses of Yubico’s technology

Required Skills & Experience

  • 3+ years in a product security role
  • 5+ years of software development
  • Proficiency in threat modeling
  • Proficiency in Go, C#, Python or Java
  • Knowledge of common vulnerability classes

Optional Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science or similar fields
  • Knowledge of WebAuthn, OATH HOTP, OATH TOTP, U2F, PIV, or OpenPGP
  • Experience developing solutions on Google Cloud, Azure, or AWS
  • Proficiency in C/C++, Rust, or Javascript
  • Formal experience training on secure development concepts and practices

Job Details

  • All security team members must be able to travel to Yubico’s other offices in Stockholm, Sweden, Palo Alto, CA, and Bellevue, WA at least two times per year. Travel is subject to COVID-19 restrictions and precautions.
  • Start date: immediately
  • Hours: full time
  • Competitive salary + Bonus + Benefits + Stock options

We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, veteran or disability status. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
About Us

Pliancy is fundamentally changing the way businesses value technology by empowering the next evolution of IT leadership. We provide white-glove consulting solutions to life science and finance organizations. Our employees and clients find that we’re starkly different from other IT organizations because we challenge the status quo in two major ways: by putting people first in every decision we make, and by innovating towards simplicity and sustainability. Whether streamlining a client’s race to a cancer cure or securing the fine details of data integrity, we’re driven to help people.

And as a people-first company that invests in the long-term success of our employees, we’re looking for creative thinkers who like to solve interesting problems. We have a culture of mentorship, and prioritize curiosity and empathy in our hiring decisions.

Engineering at Pliancy

Within engineering, our mission is to make technology consulting amazing by creating software that automates the mundane and lends our consultants superpowers. Technology consulting is innately relationship-driven, and we empower our consultants to build those relationships with clients and deliver IT leadership and solutions that truly help them succeed in their missions. We do this through deep vertical integration into our consultants’ experiences and a culture of feedback and integrity — always doing what creates the best experiences for both ourselves and our clients.

Why work with us?

Clients solving challenging problems with meaningful purpose Top-of-their-game peers who have fun with what they do and take teamwork seriously Rapid company growth (75% year over year) with opportunity to see the impact of your efforts on the company Flexible schedule designed to empower your communication and time management skills Great culture driven by empathetic people (we really do treat our people as family) Benefits and perks built to meaningfully support you and your family while we grow together About the role

This is a strategically important role within our small, yet focused engineering team, designed to help refine and execute on our vision. You will work closely with engineering leadership and many other stakeholders to look forward and create strategy for where we’re going, as well as jump into the code to help us get there.

An average day

While we all know there is no average day in engineering, let’s try and paint a picture for you:

First, you’re in a meeting to go over final design considerations for a project you’ve been working on to improve time management for consultants (billing their time to clients). During the meeting you get a Slack message that something isn’t quite working right with the new frontend feature in staging on certain browsers, so you finish up and go help scope what might be going on while daydreaming better ways to automate testing in local dev, so that these things can be found faster in the pipeline. You pop open your IDE and knock out a particularly critical part of the authentication logic for a new API microservice meant to support streaming user information from a third-party system. Another feature project is also in the works and the database design still isn’t nailed down… you go poke some of the stakeholders with questions to try to scope in the requirements and figure out what’s going to result in the best outcome. Towards the end of the day you draft a Slack announcement about a big feature release that is going live (finally!) and the emojis go wild on the post. Success!

Core responsibilities to our mission

Expert leadership and mentorship for software development across the full technology stack (database design to frontend development) Work with the business to identify ways to better support our consultants and scale our technology solutions to support the industry needs Act as a domain expert with regard to software design and engineering Build a sustainable development practice; find ways to improve execution through meaningful testing and process improvements that drive reliability Architect both software and systems to support the vision with a bias for simplicity and automation Lead new feature development lifecycles and help resolve issues as they inevitably arise Requirements

Who are we looking for?

You are deeply driven to improve others' experiences. You lead by example and thrive seeing your peers grow and mentoring them along the way. You use a first-principles approach to understanding challenges and problems.

You also have attention to detail with everything you do and want to create outcomes that impress those around you, embracing failure as a lesson and providing honest feedback to everyone equally. You have a deep understanding of API design best practices and building a stable API for consumption by multiple end systems. You have strong experience with authentication systems and identity management with regard to software design.

You’re an expert in:

  • Modern web technologies (Typescript and NodeJS backend experience highly desired)
  • Software reliability, with a focus on best practices that increase deployment confidence
  • Front-end frameworks, such as Vue (preferred), Svelte, or React
  • Scalable cloud-native systems design, with technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and other IaaS design paradigms

Benefits

  • Generous salary, above-average pay ($175K-$210K dependent on experience)
  • “Cadillac” healthcare: Anthem Blue Cross Gold Plan (Premiums 100% covered for employees, 50% for dependents)
  • Medical HRA: Company-funded reimbursement account to help cover copays, deductibles, and coinsurance
  • Dental and vision coverage
  • 401K + 6% company matching (available from your first day)
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Wellness reimbursement up to $100 per month
  • Cell phone reimbursement
  • Home internet reimbursement
  • Commuter benefits

As one of the largest and most comprehensive public health organizations in the nation, we are at the forefront of research and innovations to improve the efficacy of public health statewide, nationally, and internationally.
